description: Smallest even number that is an unordered sum of two odd primes in exactly n ways.
references: N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Eric Wolman, Letter to N. J. A. Sloane, 1970.
Index entries for sequences related to Goldbach conjecture
mathematica: nn = 55; a = Table[0, {nn}]; n = 6; While[Times @@ a == 0, c = 0; k = 3; While[k <= n/2, If[PrimeQ[k] && PrimeQ[n - k], c++]; k++]; If[c <= nn && a[[c]] == 0, a[[c]] = n]; n = n + 2]; Prepend[a, 0]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Eric Wolman, Dec 17 1969
